sub_title: Pay-for-performance Manager at Monster | Freelance Marketeer & Copywriter
summary: Marketing professional with more than 10 years of experience at several international companies. Now broadening my skills within the labor market where I lead projects across several departments. As a person I’m result driven and analytical. Besides my challenging, but at the same time very rewarding position at Monster, I’m also as a freelancer helping other companies to expand or grow their businesses on the Swedish market. I’m fluent in Swedish, Dutch and English which makes me adaptable to most teams and organizations. Experience in managing a team of both fulltimers and interns. Biggest strengths are project management and planning. NIMA marketing A and Consumer marketing B diploma.

profile_positions.description:
Monster is a platform helping companies achieve their recruitment goals, while making it possible for job seekers (both active and passive) to find their perfect fit. Monster has developed a new unique model where clients are only paying for performance (apply start or apply finish). 

In my position as PFP Manager I’m responsible for the performance of Sweden and the UK. Besides the budget and revenue targets, I’m also overseeing the whole process of the pay-for-performance model in different disciplines from sales and onboarding via customer service to performance marketing and customer success management. Through quarterly key objectives I’m also running projects to develop and improve the PFP-model and the service we offer our clients.
profile_positions.title: Pay-for-performance Manager

profile_positions.description:
As Swedish freelance marketer, copywriter and translator I’m helping companies entering or growing their business on the Swedish market. A selection of assignments:

I helped HappySoaps, which is a Dutch brand offering 100% plastic free and natural care products, to launch their business on the Swedish market. This includes pricing strategy, online marketing activities, creation and localization of content, setting up a team and work flows. 

Dott is a sustainable mobility company offering shareable e-bikes and e-scooters in cities across whole Europe. As a freelancer I have been helping them to launch the business in Sweden and I’m working with the communication and copywriting for the website, app and campaigns on an ongoing basis. 

Onlyhumans is a marketing agency based in Antwerp. During this assignment I’m doing keyword research, intent mapping and SE copywriting for one of their clients within the waterproofing and insulation business, based on a pillar-cluster content strategy. Additionally I’m writing copy for blog- and social media posts.

Korsit offers a wide range of digital redeemable cards, gift cards and game keys. As SE copywriter I do copywriting and keyword research for their website Dundle SE. In the past I have transcreated their website into Swedish and today I’m writing the Swedish copy for new pages and products, plus provide content creation for blog posts.
profile_positions.title: Marketer & Copywriter

profile_positions.description: Oberst is a platform which makes daily deals available for everyone. As website specialist my tasks were to update the website with relevant content and offers based on SEO and agreements with partners. My focus country was always Sweden (www.sokrabatt.se), but I was also working regularly on the Norwegian website.
profile_positions.title: Website Specialist

profile_positions.description:
TravelBird is an online travel agency offering a broad portfolio of inspirational holidays. The company was founded 2010 in Amsterdam and grew massively in the coming years. TravelBird is since November 2018 part of the British Secret Escape Group. 

I started as online marketeer for Sweden where my main tasks were to generate traffic via affiliate, social media and partnerships. My tasks also included lead generation activities and I lead a few project and campaigns on a global level. 

From February 2017 I took the lead for the whole online marketing Nordics team, including Denmark, Finland, Norway and Sweden. I was responsible for the overall targets and budgets. 2-3 marketing interns and 1 online marketeer reported directly to me and I was responsible for the structure and performance of the team. On a global level I was managing the central planning and marketing campaigns.

In July 2017 I shifted focus to partnerships, in the bigger markets Netherlands and Belgium. My main responsibilities were to grow the affiliate channel and set up successful direct partnerships. Additional I sat up a side project, were we successfully tested Direct Mail for the first time in NL and BE.
profile_positions.title: Online marketeer

profile_positions.description:
Albumprinter (known as Albelli in The Netherlands) acquired the Swedish brand Önskefoto in 2011. Önskefoto has been selling photo finishing products for over 40 years and is today one of the leading companies on the photo product market. The vision is to make it easier for the customers to create beautiful photo products and to share & relive their memories.

From May 2012 to June 2016 I was based in Albumprinter´s headquarter in Amsterdam. I worked as the spin in the web to connect the central teams with my colleagues in Sweden. I was responsible for the products photo calendar and the student products and my work included, but was not limited to, creating operational marketing plans, planning and execution of online and offline activities such as BINS, Direct Mail, Out of pocket partner campaigns, strategic partner campaigns, social media activities and contests, sponsorships, supervising of marketing interns etc. I also worked closely together with the central marketing teams (CRM, Affiliates, SEA, SEO and Display) to make sure we reached the right target groups at the right moment. During my time at Önskefoto I got experience to work with WordPress, Clang, Woobox and internal BackOffice systems.
profile_positions.title: Marketeer Sweden

profile_positions.description:
Klarna was founded in Stockholm 2005 with a simple and clear vision; To make it easier for people to shop online. The idea was that the consumer should receive the product before paying and the store should get paid within 2 weeks even if the customer did not paid yet. This business idea was a great success. The company was growing fast and operated in several European countries already in 2010. Today Klarna is one of the biggest banks in Europe and offer payment solutions to 60 million customers, for 100.000 stores in 14 countries. 

During my time at Klarna I worked at the Merchant support where I was the first contact for the stores using the Klarna payment solution. The tasks included, but were not limited to, administrative work, such as adding new or removing old stores, helping the stores to start up their shops and answering less or more technical questions about the payment solution, the customers or the invoices.
profile_positions.title: Merchant support

volunteer_experiences.description: In fall 2009, I went to Tamil Nadu in India to work as a volunteer in an orphanage. Around 100 children, age 7 to 18 years, lived in the orphanage. My tasks mainly included social support to these children. During the day the children went to a public school and in this time the orphanage instead worked as a school for other younger children, age 3 to 6 years, from very poor families in the surroundings. I worked as English teacher to these children during the week days. The volunteer work was organized by Aid India (via Volontärresor AB) and I was very impressed by the engagement the founder of the orphanage showed towards the children. He truly succeeded with making them feel loved and belonging. This was an amazing experience.
